meanings.definition: A person who establishes or founds an institution.
meanings.sent1: The institutors of the school worked hard to create a welcoming environment for students.
meanings.sent2: The institutors of the museum carefully planned the exhibits to educate visitors.
meanings.sent3: The institutors of the library decided to organize a book-themed party for the community.
meanings.sent4: The institutors of the hospital laid the foundation of compassionate care for all patients.
meanings.sent5: The institutors of the charity dedicated their lives to helping those in need.

meanings.definition: The act of establishing or founding an institution.
meanings.sent1: The institutors of the new university faced many challenges during the planning phase.
meanings.sent2: The institutors of the business alliance signed the agreement to formalize their partnership.
meanings.sent3: The institutors of the club celebrated their success with a grand opening event.
meanings.sent4: The institutors of the foundation laid the groundwork for future philanthropic endeavors.
meanings.sent5: The institutors of the organization set out to make a positive impact on society.
